</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Defines the area monitored by the given trigger. The area could be either rectangular or elliptical. Since Arma 3 v1.59.135137 it is possible to define 3 dimensional area to monitor by specifying extra param for the area height (see pic). 
<br><br>Just like with a and b dimensions, c dimension will alter area in opposite directions from the trigger position along z axis. Therefore if the trigger position is on the surface, half of the trigger area will be above the surface and half below. To place the whole area above the surface, adjust trigger position (move it up c meters). If c is not specified or <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>&lt;=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> 0, the trigger area considered infinitely tall, like in old triggers. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> trigger '''setTriggerArea''' [a, b, angle, isRectangle, c] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> trigger: [[Object]] - object of the type "EmptyDetector"</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> [a, b, angle, isRectangle, c]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> a: [[Number]] - trigger area X size / 2, in meters </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p4</name>=<value> b: [[Number]] - trigger area Y size / 2, in meters </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p5</name>=<value> angle: [[Number]] - trigger area rotation in degrees </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER5</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p6</name>=<value> isRectangle: [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if rectangle </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER6</name>=<value>
</value></part><part><name>p7</name>=<value> c (Optional): [[Number]] - trigger area Z size / 2, in meters &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (''Since Arma 3 v1.59.135137'') </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER7</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
<br>[[Image:setTriggerArea.jpg|300px]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
